poem:
**In the Morning News**

Today, the page reads like a map  
of lines drawn by old hands.  
Figures rise, flags unfurl  
in each shaded corner of the earth.  
Yet beyond borders,  
seeds of doubt blossom—  
thick roots pushing up through  
the red dust,  
cracking the hard line  
between night and some new  
shimmering dawn.
